metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25647 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. During USB device initialization, descriptors are read with very little bounds checking and assumes the USB device is providing sane values. If properly exploited, an attacker could trigger memory corruption leading to arbitrary code execution allowing a bypass of the Secure Boot mechanism. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Joseph Tartaro and Ilja van Sprundel

notes.Note: sbeattie> Ubuntu packaging does not include the usb module in the signed EFI grub artifacts, so is not affected. grub2-unsigned will contain fixes and supersede grub2, which will contain only BIOS grub bits.

criterions.comment: grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
grub2-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
